purpleculture_pinyin:
lǎn
cable; hawser; to moor
кабель; трос; пришвартоваться
purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 缆)
Pictophonetic: 覽 indicates the sound; 糹 (thread) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
纜車 [ lǎn chē ]: cable car
纜繩 [ lǎn shéng ]: cable; hawser; mooring rope
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 糹 [ sī ] silk; thread
    • 覽 [ lǎn ] to look over, to inspect, to view, to perceive
heisig_chinese_memo: Look closely with a magnifying glass at the wires inside a cable and they basically look like metal threads.
Ru_trainchinese: lǎn: (сущ/глаг) кабель, канат; трос, бечева; привязать канатом, пришвартоваться
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: Look closely with a magnifying glass at the wires inside a cable and they basically look like metal threads.
humanum_full_description_en:
From "糸", " View " sound. The original meaning is a rope used to tie a ship. "Ji Yun. Kan Yun: "Lane, Wei Zhouyi." Such as "Three Kingdoms. Wu Shu. "The Legend of Gan Ning": "The people on the educated boats have more cables, undressing and lying in the boat." "Selected Works. Xie Lingyun "Dang Lin Hai Qiao's first strong masterpiece and his younger brother Hui Lian to see the sheep He Gonghe Zhi": "When the sunset is thin, the mooring Linjiang Tower." Li Shan's note: "The cable, the boat is also the boat."

" Cable " as a verb means to tie a ship with a rope. "Jade articles. "Itobe": "The cable, Weizhou also." Such as "Shu Yi Ji. "Volume 1": "In Yongkang County, Dongyang County, there were people entering the mountains in the Wu period. They met the big tortoises and carried them. When they were not home, they were on the shore at night." Su Shi of the Northern Song Dynasty, "The Book of the Award Letter": "Hundreds of public and private ships, Dare to go with the wind and waves, and divide the city down."

" Cable " also refers to things like cables, such as "cables" and "steel cables".
humanum_short_description_en: From "糸", " View " sound. The original meaning is the rope used to tie the ship, and it also means the action of using the rope to tie the ship.
humanum_full_description:
從「糸」，「覽」聲。本義是繫船用的繩索。《集韻．闞韻》：「纜，維舟絙。」如《三國志．吳書．甘寧傳》：「敕船人更增舸纜，解衣臥船中。」《文選．謝靈運〈登臨海嶠初發彊中作與從弟惠連見羊何共和之〉》：「日落當棲薄，繫纜臨江樓。」李善注：「纜，維舟索也。」

　　「纜」作動詞，表示用繩索繫船。《玉篇．糸部》：「纜，維舟也。」如《述異記．卷上》：「東陽郡永康縣，吳時有人入山，逢大龜，擔之，未至家，遇夜，纜舟於岸。」北宋蘇軾〈獎諭敕記〉：「公私船數百，以風浪不敢行，分纜城下。」

　　「纜」又泛指像纜繩的東西，如「電纜」、「鋼纜」等。
humanum_short_description: 從「糸」，「覽」聲。本義是繫船用的繩索，又表示以繩繫船的動作。

纜字的基本解释

纜
lǎn
见“缆”。

纜字的汉语字典释义

[①]［lǎn］
［《廣韻》盧瞰切，去闞，來。］
“缆1”的繁体字。
(1)系船的粗绳或铁索。
(2)以索系船。
(3)许多股拧成的像缆的东西。

纜字的康熙字典解释

【未集中】【糸字部】　纜； 康熙笔画：27； 页码：页944第18
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】【正韻】?盧瞰切，音濫。【玉篇】維舟索也。【杜甫·城西陂泛舟詩】遲日徐看錦纜牽。【正韻】俗作䌫。

纜字的源字形

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
纜字的起名意思

暂无。

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［lǎn］
["Guangyun" Lu Kanqi, go to Kan, come. ]
Traditional characters for "順1".
(1) The thick rope or iron rope used to moor the ship.
(2) Mooring the ship by rope.
(3) Many strands are twisted like a cable.
